column4: hell I mean my box is no scream machine but for Linux its fast enough, AMD 1.1 on 384MB, and I'm even running Blackbox on a custom compiled kernel, with just about all the startup services killed, and XINE is still choppy
I  mean hell thats crap
errrr
I'm trying to think what I can do
hmm
is dma turned on all drives?
not sure, and cant remember how to check
hdparm -tT
hdparm -tT /dev/hdx
Timing cached reads:   436 MB in  2.02 seconds = 216.30 MB/sec
does it say dma (on)?
no I didnt see that just what I pasted you
what Ubuntu has it off by default?
not on harddrives but sometimes roms do not have it turned on. use hdparm on your drives with no -tT
sorry run it how?
haparm /dev/hdx
hdparm /dev/hdx
hdparm  /dev/hdx
using_dma    =  1 (on)
do all of your drives like that
I only have one drive, and I ran that
surely you have a rom device, which is another drive
I cant say I know about the rom
I just have one hdd --> /dev/hda
